title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Roswell Waldo to Orlando Brown, October 31, 1868
summary: Waldo's report comments on the rising need for Bureau aid as demand for labor decreases, as well as the prevalence of intemperance, which has largely gone unnoticed accoring to Waldo because of the efforts to keep alcohol consumption "clandestine."
keywords: Aid/Relief, Community Values/Local Behaviour, Education, Women, Employment/Labor, Race Relations, Administration/Bureaucracy, American Civil War
